input

Class InputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • input.InputHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class InputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Handles keyboard input for controlling a Player object in the game. It listens for specific key events to perform actions such as moving, jumping, attacking, and special attacks. This class is responsible for linking player actions with corresponding keyboard keys.
    Since:
    1.0

      • InputHandler

        public InputHandler(Player p,
                    GameLevel gameLevel)
        Constructs an InputHandler with a specified Player and GameLevel.
        Parameters:
        p - The player to be controlled.
        gameLevel - The current level of the game.

    • Method Detail

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Handles key press events to perform player actions. Defines behavior for moving left, right, jumping, attacking, and special attacks based on the keys pressed.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - The KeyEvent triggered by pressing a key.

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Handles key release events to stop or modify player actions. This includes stopping movement, ending attacks, or changing back to idle states.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - The KeyEvent triggered by releasing a key.

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(Player newPlayer)
        Sets a new Player object for the input handler to control. This method is used to update the player instance being controlled when switching levels.
        Parameters:
        newPlayer - The new Player object to control.

      • stopMoving

        private void stopMoving()
        Stops the player's movement and resets the key pressed states. This method is called before performing actions that require the player to stop, such as attacking or executing a special attack.
